isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - REMOVE - DRIVE PINION ASSEMBLY

note.para: The nut for the drive pinion was loosened when the input shaft assembly was removed.

step1.para: Remove the nut and washer from the drive pinion.
Remove the drive pinion from the carrier according to the following procedure ( Figure 33).

figure.caption: Figure 33. Remove Drive Pinion From Carrier

warning.para: Observe all warnings and cautions concerning press operation to avoid serious personal injury and possible damage to components.

step2.para: Put differential carrier in a press so the threaded end of the drive pinion is facing up. Put the supports under the mounting flange of the carrier.
Put a protector on the top of the shaft of the drive pinion.

caution.para: Make sure the drive pinion does not fall on the floor when the drive pinion is pressed from the carrier.

step2.para: Press the pinion through the outer bearing cone and the helical driven gear. Remove the drive pinion from the bottom of the carrier.
Remove the outer spacer, the outer bearing cone and the helical driven gear from the carrier. Remove the inner spacer from the drive pinion.

note.para: If either the bearing cup or the cone needs to be replaced, both parts must be replaced as a matched set.
If a new ring gear and drive pinion are being installed, the inner bearing cup must be removed to change the shim pack between the cup and the carrier.

step1.para: If necessary, remove the inner and the outer bearing cups from the carrier. Use a hammer and a drift to remove the cups from the carrier. Replace any shims that are damaged. Measure and record the thickness of the shim pack for use during assembly ( Figure 34

figure.caption: Figure 34. Remove Inner and Outer Bearing Cup

step1.para: If necessary, remove the inner bearing cone from the drive pinion. Put a bearing puller under the inner race to support the bearing. Put a protector on top of the pinion shaft and press the drive pinion out of the bearing cone ( Figure 35).

figure.caption: Figure 35. Press Drive Pinion Out of Bearing Cone
